result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavon Natatale Leflore Sr.

records.addlTxt: State's Response to Motion to Dismiss, filed.

Defendant Lavon Natatale Leflore Sr. appeared by video.  Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt appeared by video for Lavon Natatale Leflore Sr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Oral Ruling.  Defense Motion to Dismiss recently filed and State requests additional time to file a response. Court sets deadline of 10/31/2022 for the State to file its response. Case adjourned to Br 9.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Exhibit 3 to Motion to Dismiss - Judgment for Fees, filed.
Exhibit 2 to Motion to Dismiss - Criminal Complaint 20CF244, filed.
Exhibit 1 to Motion to Dismiss - Transcript, filed.
Correspondence to Court from Attorney Misfeldt dated 9/13/2022, filed

Defendant Lavon Natatale Leflore in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling confernce.  Defense requested a little more time due to waiting for transcripts, and will be filing a motion to dismiss this case.  State does not object.  Court GRANTED the defenses motion to waive the preliminary hearing time limits due to Good Cause.  Case schedule for IN PERSON oral decision.  Court scheduled deadline for defense to file motion by August, 24, 2022, and scheduled deadline for state to file motion by September 9, 2022.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Oral ruling scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Time limit waived by defense for preliminary hearing.

Defendant Lavon Natatale Leflore in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Court nofitied parties that a preliminary hearing needs to still be held. Court scheduled the preliminary hearing with parties. Court informed the court that they will be filing a motion to dismiss due to reasons stated on the record. Court GRANTED the defenses motion to waive the preliminary hearing time limits due to Good Cause. Court informs the parties that any motions are to be filed by July 19th, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Signed and filed. Sent to assigned attorney.

Defendant Lavon Natatale Leflore in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $20.00 per month beginning on June 1st, 2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court contacted possible attorney's via email correspondense to find available attorney. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Indigency hearing on May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lavon Natatale Leflore in court by video.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lavon Natatale Leflore in court with attorney David Thomas Conley.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/22/2022 @ 2:30pm
